audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization - automating product categorization improves existing catalog management process. Highly replicable pattern for any retailer with large product portfolios.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (Wayfair), specific scope (30 million products), credible source. Time-to-market improvement is measurable outcome.
audited_claims.notes: Strong Tier 1 case - optimizes existing product management function with clear efficiency gains

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization - eliminating manual tagging reduces operational costs in existing process. Replicable for similar catalog operations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization and specific process described, but cost savings not quantified. 'Delivered cost savings' is vague without metrics.
audited_claims.notes: Good strategic fit but lacks quantified savings metrics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimizes existing e-commerce function - better product attributes should improve conversion. Replicable pattern for online retailers.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization with logical causal chain (better attributes → better conversion), but conversion rate improvement not quantified.
audited_claims.notes: Reasonable claim but lacks specific conversion rate metrics

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of ML development process - dramatically reduces time for model tuning. Highly replicable for organizations doing ML development.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization with very specific time reduction metric (2 weeks → 1 hour). Dramatic but credible improvement in bounded process.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk

audited_claims.notes: Excellent Tier 1 case - specific, dramatic efficiency gain in technical process

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimizes ML deployment process with massive efficiency gain. Pattern highly replicable for ML-driven organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization, very specific time reduction (1 month → 1 hour), detailed explanation of automation approach. Highly credible.
audited_claims.notes: Outstanding Tier 1 case - dramatic process optimization with clear methodology

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Optimizes organizational workflow by reducing dependencies between teams. Enables self-service model development. Replicable for data science organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization with clear process improvement described. Removes bottleneck between data scientists and engineers.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage human resources planning, policies, and strategies
Develop and manage IT resilience and risk

audited_claims.notes: Good organizational efficiency improvement - reduces cross-team dependencies

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Too general - describes ML usage scope rather than specific functional optimization. No clear efficiency, cost, or quality improvement described.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: While organization is named and customer count is specific, this is a capability statement rather than an improvement claim.
audited_claims.notes: Not a valid Tier 1 claim - describes scale of ML usage rather than optimization outcome

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. All valid claims describe functional optimizations within existing business model - product management, ML development processes, and organizational workflows. No business model transformation or new revenue streams described.
